content: On September 14, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced the Philadelphia Phillies in a pivotal game that marked a turning point in their season. Tom Glavine pitched a stellar game, throwing a complete game shutout while striking out 10 batters, leading the Braves to a 5-0 victory. This win was crucial as it helped the Braves inch closer to the postseason, ultimately propelling them to a remarkable turnaround season that culminated in an appearance in the World Series.
